studies.study_title: Nabiximols for Chronic Insomnia: Phase 2 Trial
studies.citation: Suraev AS, Marshall NS, Vandrey R, et al. 2020. Sleep; PMID: 32430450; doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2019-034421.
studies.title: Nabiximols for Chronic Insomnia: Phase 2 Trial
studies.authors: Suraev AS, Marshall NS, Vandrey R, et al.

outcomes.results: Nabiximols: ISI reduced 4.6 points vs Placebo: 2.3 (p=0.03); Sleep onset latency reduced 25 min; Wake after sleep onset reduced 17 min
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep efficiency improved 8.4%; total sleep time increased 22 min; daytime functioning improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - First rigorous cannabinoid insomnia RCT; objective PSG measures; FDA-pathway drug

studies.study_title: CBD for Anxiety-Related Insomnia: Clinical Trial
studies.citation: Shannon S, Lewis N, Lee H, et al. 2019. Permanente Journal.
studies.title: CBD for Anxiety-Related Insomnia: Clinical Trial
studies.authors: Shannon S, Lewis N, Lee H, et al.
studies.sample_size: 72 adults with anxiety and sleep complaints

outcomes.results: Sleep improved in 66.7% at Month 1; Sustained at 56.1% at Month 3; PSQI improved mean 2.8 points
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Anxiety improved 79.2% at Month 1; well-tolerated; no significant adverse effects

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Real-world clinical setting; anxiety-insomnia comorbidity; supports CBD sleep indication

studies.study_title: THC/CBD Extract for Sleep Disturbance: Crossover Trial
studies.citation: Nicholson AN, Turner C, Stone BM, et al. 2004. Journal of Clinical Psychopharmacology; PMID: 15118485; doi: 10.1097/01.jcp.0000125688.05091.8f.
studies.title: THC/CBD Extract for Sleep Disturbance: Crossover Trial
studies.authors: Nicholson AN, Turner C, Stone BM, et al.

intervention.cannabinoid: THC alone, CBD alone, THC+CBD combination

outcomes.results: THC+CBD: Reduced wake time; THC alone: Increased sleepiness but decreased Stage 3; CBD 15mg: No sedation; CBD may offset THC morning impairment
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: CBD counteracted THC morning grogginess; combination profile optimal; ratio-dependent effects

safety.adverse_events: THC alone: morning impairment; combination better tolerated

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - PSG-validated; THC:CBD ratio importance; mechanistic sleep data

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis for Insomnia: Large Registry Study
studies.citation: Vigil JM, Stith SS, Diviant JP, et al. 2018. Medicines; PMID: 30210337; doi: 10.3389/fphar.2018.00916.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis for Insomnia: Large Registry Study
studies.authors: Vigil JM, Stith SS, Diviant JP, et al.

outcomes.results: 4.5-point average improvement (0-10 scale); 74% reported significant benefit; THC content positively correlated with effect
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Indica strains preferred for sleep; myrcene terpene associated with sedation; CBD-only less effective for sleep

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Large real-world data; strain/terpene analysis; supports NeuroBotanica platform

studies.study_title: Cannabinoids for Sleep Disorders: Systematic Review
studies.citation: Kuhathasan N, Dufort A, MacKillop J, et al. 2019. Sleep Medicine Reviews; PMID: 31120284; doi: 10.1037/pha0000285.
studies.title: Cannabinoids for Sleep Disorders: Systematic Review
studies.authors: Kuhathasan N, Dufort A, MacKillop J, et al.

outcomes.results: 15/26 studies showed sleep improvement; THC most consistently sedating; CBD effects variable; nabilone effective for sleep-disordered conditions
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Dose-dependent effects; tolerance concerns with chronic THC; secondary insomnia more responsive

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Comprehensive evidence synthesis; identifies research gaps; guides future trials

studies.study_title: Nabilone for Sleep in Fibromyalgia: RCT
studies.citation: Ware MA, Fitzcharles MA, Joseph L, et al. 2010. Anesthesia & Analgesia.
studies.title: Nabilone for Sleep in Fibromyalgia: RCT
studies.authors: Ware MA, Fitzcharles MA, Joseph L, et al.

outcomes.results: Nabilone: ISI 11.2 vs Amitriptyline: 13.4 (p=0.03); Sleep quality significantly better with nabilone
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Pain reduced; quality of life improved; less morning grogginess than amitriptyline

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - FDA-approved drug (nabilone); head-to-head vs standard; fibromyalgia-insomnia comorbidity

studies.citation: Kesner AJ, Lovinger DM. 2020. Neuropharmacology; PMID: 32774241; doi: 10.3389/fnmol.2020.00125.
studies.title: Endocannabinoid System and Sleep Regulation

outcomes.results: Anandamide promotes sleep; 2-AG levels cycle with sleep-wake; CB1 modulates adenosine signaling; ECS interacts with circadian rhythm genes
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Explains THC sedation; CBD anxiolytic indirectly helps sleep; therapeutic target rationale

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - NIH-funded; explains sleep mechanism; supports cannabinoid sleep indications

studies.study_title: Cannabis Substitution for Sleep Medications: Survey Study
studies.citation: Piper BJ, DeKeuster RM, Beals ML, et al. 2017. Journal of Psychopharmacology.
studies.title: Cannabis Substitution for Sleep Medications: Survey Study
studies.authors: Piper BJ, DeKeuster RM, Beals ML, et al.

outcomes.results: 30.3% substituted cannabis for sleep aids; 65% reduced benzodiazepine use; 68% reduced Z-drug use; Better sleep quality reported
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Cost savings reported; fewer side effects; improved next-day functioning

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Medication substitution data; reduces benzodiazepine/Z-drug use; safety advantage

studies.study_title: Dronabinol for Sleep Apnea: PACE Trial
studies.citation: Carley DW, Prasad B, Reid KJ, et al. 2018. Sleep; PMID: 29121334; doi: 10.1093/sleep/zsx184.
studies.title: Dronabinol for Sleep Apnea: PACE Trial
studies.authors: Carley DW, Prasad B, Reid KJ, et al.

outcomes.results: 10mg dronabinol: AHI reduced 32% (p=0.02); Epworth Sleepiness Scale improved; Novel mechanism for OSA
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Subjective sleepiness improved; well-tolerated; no respiratory depression

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - NIH-funded; FDA-approved drug; novel OSA indication; Phase 2 success

studies.study_title: Cannabis Use and Sleep Quality: Longitudinal Study
studies.citation: Goodhines PA, Gellis LA, Ansell EB, et al. 2019. Journal of Clinical Sleep Medicine; PMID: 31169378; doi: 10.1037/hea0000765.
studies.title: Cannabis Use and Sleep Quality: Longitudinal Study
studies.authors: Goodhines PA, Gellis LA, Ansell EB, et al.

outcomes.results: Occasional use associated with better sleep outcomes than daily or non-use; Moderate use pattern optimal; Daily use showed tolerance
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Pattern-dependent effects; tolerance with daily use; cessation effects on sleep

safety.adverse_events: Daily users: withdrawal insomnia on cessation

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - NIH-funded; long-term use patterns; informs dosing recommendations

studies.study_title: The CANabidiol Use for RElief of Short Term Insomnia

key_findings: To investigate the effect of the administration of a 50mg and 100mg per day oral CBD product versus placebo over 8 weeks on insomnia severity index scores
outcome_measures: To investigate the effect of the administration of a 50mg and 100mg per day oral CBD product versus placebo over 8 weeks on insomnia severity index scores

studies.study_title: Effects of Experimental Sleep Disturbances on Receptor Function of Study Drug

intervention.cannabinoid_profile: Within-Subject test of blinded study medication (stimulant, benzodiazepine, opioid, cannabinoid, over-the-counter pain medication, or placebo)

key_findings: Percent change in receptor binding potential from PET scan
Withdrawal Latency measured in seconds during Cold Pressor Pain Tolerance test
Drug Effects as assessed by the Visual Analog Scale
The monetary valuation in dollars of the study medication as assessed by the Drug or Money Multiple Choice Questionnaire
outcome_measures: Percent change in receptor binding potential from PET scan
Withdrawal Latency measured in seconds during Cold Pressor Pain Tolerance test
Drug Effects as assessed by the Visual Analog Scale
The monetary valuation in dollars of the study medication as assessed by the Drug or Money Multiple Choice Questionnaire

key_findings: Average Patients' Global Impression of Change (PGIC) for overall cancer-related symptoms
outcome_measures: Average Patients' Global Impression of Change (PGIC) for overall cancer-related symptoms

studies.study_title: Reducing Cannabis Use for Sleep Among Adults Using Medical Cannabis

intervention.cannabinoid_profile: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia in Cannabis Users (CBTi-CB)

key_findings: Change From Baseline Insomnia Severity Index Score at Study Completion
outcome_measures: Change From Baseline Insomnia Severity Index Score at Study Completion

studies.study_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Dronabinol to Treat Obstructive Sleep Apnea

key_findings: Change in Apnea/Hypopnea Index (AHI)
Change in Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS)
Change in Sleep Latency: Maintenance of Wakefulness Test (MWT)
outcome_measures: Change in Apnea/Hypopnea Index (AHI)
Change in Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS)
Change in Sleep Latency: Maintenance of Wakefulness Test (MWT)

Mean Difference in Depression Subscale Scores From the HADS Averaged Over 2, 4, and 12 Weeks
Mean Difference in Anxiety Subscale Scores From the HADS Averaged Over 2, 4, and 12 Weeks
Mean Difference in Pain Severity Scores on the BPI Average Over 2, 4, and 12 Weeks
Mean Difference in Sleep Scores on the AIS Averaged Over 2, 4, and 12 Weeks
